title: Wet Sleddale Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Michael Graham / Wet Sleddale Reservoir
images.caption: Wet Sleddale Reservoir. Looking north from near to New Ing.

images.title: William Bartlett / Sleddale Hall
images.caption: Sleddale Hall. Now famous as the film location "Crow Crag" in the 1986 film "Withnail and I". The "cottage" in the film is owned by Uncle Monty; from whom Withnail borrows the key. The two out of work actors come to a wet "Crow Crag" on holiday by mistake with no food or other provisions.

images.title: Tim Leete / Wet Sleddale reservoir and fells beyond
images.caption: The reservoir and fells beyond

images.title: mauldy / Barn above Wet Sleddale Reservoir
images.caption: Barn above the reservoir

images.title: Jim Barton / Farmland and dam, Wet Sleddale
images.caption: Farmland and dam. From the road near Green Farm, with the heather moors of Shap Fells rising beyond.

images.title: mauldy / Stream from Wet Sleddale Reservoir
images.caption: Stream from the Reservoir

images.title: Jim Barton / Weather station, Cooper's Green
images.caption: Weather station, Cooper's Green to the east of the site. An enclosure with 10m anemometer tower, thermometers, rain gauges and what I guess to be a visibility meter.

description: This circular walk takes you around Wet Sleddale Reservoir near Penrith in Cumbria. You can start the walk from the car park at the eastern end of the reservoir, next to the dam. Then pick up footpaths heading west to Sleddale Hall. Film buffs may recognise this as the location of Crow Crag from the 1987 fillm 'Withnail and I' starring Richard E Grant. You then follow trails east to Bowfield and Thorney Bank before crossing the River Lowther. Quiet country lanes will then take you west back to the car park.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the north you can extend your walking around the 13th century Shap Abbey. To the north east is Crosby Ravensworth where you can visit the 18th century pub and the ancient church which sits in a picturesque location next to the Dalebanks Beck. You can also pick up our circular walk which visits Oddendale and Crosby Ravensworth Fell where there are great views and a photogenic expanse of limestone pavement at the nearby Orton Scar.

display_address: A6, Shap Rural, Shap, Westmorland and Furness, England, CA10 3QW, United Kingdom
